intro: Licania pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered licania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) leaves and showy, clustered flowers that typically bloom in yellow or orange hues. Licania pubiflora grows as an erect shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
